instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01041: What is 820-01041? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PPVCC_S0_CPU: What is PPVCC_S0_CPU? The "PPVCC_S0_CPU" power rail is responsible for supplying power to the CPU when the MacBook is fully on, or in the S0 state. This rail is one of the main voltages that the CPU requires for operation. .
definitions.PM_RSMRST_L: What is PM_RSMRST_L? The "PM_RSMRST_L" signal, also known as "Resume Reset," is an active-low signal that is part of the power management system in MacBooks. It asserts a reset signal when it is low voltage which is what the _L is for. Is the machine is in a reset stage it will not properly power on..
definitions.PP5V_G3S: What is PP5V_G3S? PP5V_G3S is a 5v power rail present when the system is in a G3S standby state.
definitions.PP1V2_S3: What is PP1V2_S3? PP1V2_S3 is a 1.2v power rail present when the machine is in an S3 suspend to RAM state.
definitions.PM_PCH_PWROK: What is PM_PCH_PWROK? PM_PCH_PWROK is usually created by U1950, a 74LVC2G08GT chip and is necessary for the machine to wake from an S5 and S4 state and turn on. This signal will be present if ALL_SYS_PWRGD, CPU_VR_PGOOD, PP3V3_S0, and PP3V42_G3H are present. When this signal is not present or intermittent, usually pin 8 on U1950 for PP3V42_G3H is corroded..
definitions.PLT_RST_L: What is PLT_RST_L? This is an abbreviation of “PLT_RESET_L” – when you see “PLT_RST_L", assume the person meant to type PLT_RESET_L.
definitions.PM_SYSRST_L: What is PM_SYSRST_L? PM_SYSRST_L is a system reset signal present when it is low, _L means the signal asserts itself when the voltage is low. This signal needs to be high for the system to exit reset mode & turn on properly. .
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.PM_SLP_S3_L: What is PM_SLP_S3_L? PM_SLP_S3_L puts the machine to sleep in an S3 state when it is asserted, the _L means it is asserted when it is low voltage. When this signal is 3.3v the machine will be asked to turn on S0 power rails and begin the bootup process.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  NO POWER
threads.message:
This board had little liquid damage, and its not turning on, 
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 12.6
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_SOCPMU</SIGNAL> = 3,3
<SIGNAL>PP1V2_S3</SIGNAL> = 0
<SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> = 0
<SIGNAL>PP5V_G3S</SIGNAL> = 5,13
PP1V5R1V35_S0_GPU_MEM = 0
<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_GPU</SIGNAL> = 0
<SIGNAL>CPU_PWRGD</SIGNAL> = 0
<SIGNAL>PMU_ONOFF_R_L</SIGNAL> = 1,3 
<SIGNAL>PM_SYSRST_L</SIGNAL> = 0
<SIGNAL>PM_PCH_SYS_PWROK</SIGNAL> = 0
<SIGNAL>PM_PCH_PWROK</SIGNAL> = 0
<SIGNAL>PLT_RST_L</SIGNAL> = 0
<SIGNAL>PM_RSMRST_L</SIGNAL> =  3,3
<SIGNAL>SMC_SYSRST_L</SIGNAL> = 0
<SIGNAL>PVCCIO_EN</SIGNAL> = 0

don´t know where to start... if I force DFU mode injecting 3v, it stays in 5v, is that normal?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  NO POWER
threads.message:
The board should enter DFU, if you get all AWAKE and SLPS2R voltages.
It will stay on 5V at USB-C input then, as normal.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  NO POWER
threads.message: I was able to access it in DFU mode, the firmware was restored correctly, but never saw image on the screen, then tried to connect it to a external hdmi screen but it´s not turning on... can you please tell me which voltages are needed on the power sequence in that model? Thank you!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  NO POWER
threads.message: Check if you get voltage on the big coils; RAM, PCH, CPU, etc...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  NO POWER
threads.message:
I dont get voltages on big coils exept for: L7030 and L7660
<SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0SW</SIGNAL> is not present on the PMU  I get all the voltages but that one and I´m not sure but it seems to be created in <CHIP>U7800</CHIP> is that right?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  NO POWER
threads.message:
If you post so ambigous information, I cannot help  :(.
You are telling to NOT get coils voltage, except two, and next line you say to get ALL VOLTAGES.
What should I understand, or how???

Which are these "all voltages" you get on the board?
If you don't get voltage on more coils than L7030/660, why would you look for an S0 voltage?

Trigger <SIGNAL>PMU_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> and check for drop pulse at <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> (at same time).
Use SWK000/2 pads, instead of power button.
Do the same with <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3_L</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  NO POWER
threads.message: sorry: <SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0SW</SIGNAL> is not present on the PMU I get all PMU voltages but that one and I´m not sure but it seems to be created in <CHIP>U7800</CHIP> is that right?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  NO POWER
threads.message:
Tried triggering <SIGNAL>PMU_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> 
<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3_L</SIGNAL> = 0
<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> = 0

on my usb c voltage meter when I connect the computer i get this 
5v transition to 20v with a .200 Amp consumption for 2 seconds then drops to 30 miliamps...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  NO POWER
threads.message:
Did you try SMC bypass?
If is not a SMC sensor issue, then may have a short in a secondary power supply.

I hope you'checked the mentioned reactions at same time when triggering <SIGNAL>PMU_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL>.
BTW, <SIGNAL>PMU_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> stays high normally?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  NO POWER
threads.message:
I checked the reactions when connecting the usb c charger on both rails no pulse or voltage I checked them shorting <SIGNAL>PMU_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> to ground and no pulse or voltage came out of those lines. <SIGNAL>PMU_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> is high at 3.3v

I will try to bypass smc, just don´t know how to do it in this models...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  NO POWER
threads.message: Ok, i just tried SMC bypass and It just doesnt do anything... its the same behavior goes to 200 mAmps then drops to 30 mAmps...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  NO POWER
threads.message: Please help me understand what´s happening with this board... it is apparently trying to start but when I connect it to the USB C meter it gets to 5v @120-240 mAmps then makes the transition to 20.1v @200mAmps top and drops to 30mAmps. I think there is something wrong when it is at 5v. It shouldn´t take that high amperage at 5v, correct? Please Help me I am so stuck with this board!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  NO POWER
threads.message:
The problem appears when the board switches to 20V.
It tries to start and probably short on a secondary power supply is detected.
Check for pulse at all big coils, when connect the charger; at the same moment when switches 5-20V.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  NO POWER
threads.message: The only 2 coils that get some voltage and have correct values are L7030 and L7660 no other coil pulses I even checked with an osciloscope and I get nothing... don´t know what to do...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  NO POWER
threads.message:
You may have a problem with PCH.
Check the power on sequence.
[URL unfurl="true"]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1oBr-qxYVfghYimgX6pwkNbwSjpQfYbKq/view?usp=sharing[/URL]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  NO POWER
threads.message: I didn´t had <SIGNAL>PVDDQ_EN</SIGNAL> so I reballed <CHIP>U7800</CHIP> just in case... the board turned on, I connected it into the case... it showed the apple and question mark folder... now I am trying to turn it on again but it won´t. It´s stuck at 5v @250-450mAmps

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  NO POWER
threads.message:
Where was the liquid spilled?
You should have something corroded still.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  NO POWER
threads.message: The corroded area is aroud <CHIP>U3000</CHIP>, <CHIP>U3500</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  NO POWER
threads.message: Check/replace capacitors in that area.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  NO POWER
threads.message: All capacitors are good, replaced a couple of them, but no difference... Still not getting <SIGNAL>PVCCIO_EN</SIGNAL> and already changed <CHIP>U7800</CHIP> this is driving me crazy... what voltages are requiered on <CHIP>U7800</CHIP> for it to create that line?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  NO POWER
threads.message:
Did you try the board again on the desk?
Like the last time turned on...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  NO POWER
threads.message: Yes.. with the battery connected if power button pressed for a few seconds it turns on but its laggy and show the question mark folder, tried internet recovery but couldn´t complete... without the battery on my bench it just keeps stuck at 20v @40mAmps

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  NO POWER
threads.message: Try DFU restore with battery connected.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  NO POWER
threads.message: I tried it again and was able to restore, but nothing shows on the screen. There is a weird thing... when the restore finishes, instead of having DFU icon it shows a lock... this board is driving me crazy! I don´t get why it lets me access it in DFU but won´t turn on...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  NO POWER
threads.message: You've said turns on, with question mark folder.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  NO POWER
threads.message:
It did... with the battery I had to keep pressed the power button (then pressed it many times) and it turned on, but it did it 2 times, then it stopped turning on...
is <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> at 12.6 normal on this model?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  NO POWER
threads.message:
So restored the firmware again... it finished doing the installation, the computer showed the folder with question mark and suddenly turned off.
Now if I press the power button the fan spins, but there is no image on the screen... <CHIP>U1200</CHIP> is getting very hot... should I reball that one?
update: I reflowed <CHIP>U1200</CHIP>, now I´m getting 20v @650mAmps. no image on screen... do you think that is a step forward?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  NO POWER
threads.message:
You can try changing the PCH.
DFU restore must be done again after that.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  NO POWER
threads.message: Don´t have a donor board for that model, anything that can be done? <CHIP>U1200</CHIP> is heating up to 50ºC power button now turns on and off the fans, but brain dead... anything else I can do? I enter DFU again and restored it, still getting 650mAmps and no image... what do you think happened? It was the PCH all the way ?? Did I killed it? I didn´t inject any voltage or anytthing...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  NO POWER
threads.message: No need donor board, get new PCH...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  NO POWER
threads.message: where? I have looked online with the part number [B]CNL-PCH-H-USFF-QNYP 961822,[/B] nothing comes up...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  NO POWER
threads.message:
It should have the classic SRxxx code printed.
Be aware, may require a lot of patience to find it.
